ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to make custom Modules show up in heritrix2 Webui
ygData.msgSnippet: The code which builds the lists shown in the web UI lives at org.archive.crawler.webui.Settings, in the method getSubclasses(). It looks for premade text files

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to make custom Modules show up in heritrix2
 Webui
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=UIWIcJfsQRn9Zm7jTkGbQF8MVKsCcg5-AvigBdMp2ovC
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The code which builds the lists shown in the web UI lives at 
org.archive.crawler.webui.Settings, in the method getSubclasses().

It looks for premade text files of the name CLASS.subclasses to find 
options to populate the menu. It will merge the options from any 
CLASS.subclasses files found on the classpath.

So, add a org/archive/modules/Processor.subclasses file with a list of 
your additional Processor classes in the classpath somewhere (such as 
alongside your additional classes). The web UI should find it and add 
them to the list. Same goes for DecideRules and other classes selectable 
through the web UI.

- Gordon @ IA

Christian Krumm wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> can anybody tell me how to make custom modules like processors,
> DecideRules etc. show up in the create drop-down menu of the heritrix2
> webui? In heritrix 1.6.0 there was an property file for processors, but
> I can't find it in heritrix2.
> 
> Thanks a lot for your help.
> Christian
